answers.answer: Hi!Pain in the armpit that shoots down to the palm can be due to peripheral artery disease,  peripheral neuropathies as in diabetes, or peripheral nerve compression. You may need clinical examination, nerve conduction studies, blood tests and MRI for a confirmed diagnosis. Please consult your doctor regarding this. Hope this helps. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: I've been having very sharp pains under my left armpit for over a year.  I'm noticing it's becoming more frequent and more intense.  The pain usually shoots to my left palm of my hand, so I feel it there at the same time.  I don't get dizzy or short of breath or anything, but I don't know what it is.Anyone have a clue?
title: Underarm (left side only) sharp pain
